pull.title: Update OS X build instructions to use Qt 5

events.body: ACK (reviewed, tested links, tested downloadable packages)

events.message: Update OS X build instructions to use Qt 5

events.body: Updated to completely remove the section on installing git.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@ be re-done or updated every time Xcode is updated.
 There's also an assumption that you already have `git` installed. If
 not, it's the path of least resistance to install [Github for Mac](https://mac.github.com/)
 (OS X 10.7+) or
-[Git for OS X](https://code.google.com/p/git-osx-installer/). It is also
+[Git for OS X](http://sourceforge.net/projects/git-osx-installer/files/). It is also
comments.body:
from https to http, this is not nice.
Do we (or, brew) verify the hashes?

comments.body: Maybe we should also mention that installing `git` is no longer required because `git` comes with Xcode 5 and higher which is obviously required to build bitcoin.
